name: Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers
membership: Member of the British Copyright Council
goal:
The Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers (ALPSP) is the international membership trade body which works to support and represent not-for-profit organisations and institutions that publish scholarly and professional content around the world. Its membership also encompasses those that partner with and provide services to not-for-profit publishers.

ALPSP has nearly 300 members in 30 countries, who collectively publish over half the worldâ€™s total active journals as well as books, databases and other products.
interests: Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Review of Copyright Directive is key issue at current time. Direct responses to public consultations. Support other organisations, including members, to provide representations or evidence on points of issue.
